name: wrongheadedly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is based on ideas or judgments that are wrong or not suitable for a particular situation: He wrongheadedly believes that teachers don't need to be paid well since they get to take summers off. We foolishly and wrong-headedly scheduled the event for a weekend when most people would be away on holiday.
More examplesFewer examplesThe whole show was wrongheadedly cast, poorly acted, and badly directed. The lawyer insisted that his client was wrong-headedly characterized as evil when he was really just troubled.
